item.title: Denver District Judge Rules Against Denver County Judge on...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Denver District Judge Rules Against Denver County Judge on Survival Ban: The Fight for Survival Continues…

In December 2019, the Denver County Judge Barahas ruled that the Denver Camping Ban law was unconstitutional - cruel and unusual punishment. The City appealed it to the Denver District Court where Judge Eric Elliff just ruled the opposite - ruling the ban is constitutional. This Judge’s ruling is factually wrong. This fight for justice and humanity will continue to a hig...her court as we continue to struggle to survive without housing while being chased around and ticketed by cops following an unconstitutional law.

Courts around the nation have found camping ban laws unconstitutional noting them as cruel and unusual punishment. More importantly, people living without housing find these laws to be cruel and unusual punishment. How laws that make it illegal to cover yourself with a blanket in freezing weather are NOT considered cruel is beyond understanding. This latest Judge's ruling depends entirely on the idea that shelters are viable, available places to PUT people. It is time we ask...what really is the difference between being told to go to a shelter and being told to go to jail?? (If you have stayed in shelters you will understand the question).

After halting enforcement of the camping ban at the start of the COVID crisis, the Mayor has now directed police to engage camping ban enforcement as of August 7th 2020 - this direction is in opposition of CDC guidance concerning encampments during covid. The practice of chasing people from one block to another without housing them is not only cruel, it is ineffective. To continue this Ineffective practice makes no sense. People living on the streets have no other options and as a result are living in constant fear and instability as police descend on camps running people’s names, arresting anyone with old warrants no matter how petty, forcing people to pack up and move at any hour of the day or night.

This human rights struggle is not over. As long as people are living without housing, told their survival is a crime, the fight on the streets, in the legislature, and in the courts will continue.

item.title: Up in boulder...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Up in boulder...

Darren O'Connor

Boulder swept the dozen or so people camping at the municipal building well over a week ago. Now no-one gets to use it, as it's fenced off. I think it was a far... nicer and inviting space when people were camped there and living in greater safety.

Making this even more ridiculous is that just a short walk away, people are camped out near the creek. People have to sleep, and no law will change that, no fence, no arrest will change that. But Boulder does it anyway.

item.title: Sweep Postponed Tomorrow Due to Freezing Weather We just...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep Postponed Tomorrow Due to Freezing Weather

We just received confirmation from the Mayor's office that the sweep scheduled for tomorrow (Tuesday 9/8) at 25th and Arapahoe is postponed again since it will be freezing weather and snowing. This is a great relief...and the least the City can do! We do not know when it will be re-posted for a new sweep date yet... Whenever it is, residents will be left to scatter to nowhere...
Instead of coming to what was gonna be a sweep tomorrow, consider bringing warm drinks, hand warmers, or gear to people living on the streets...

item.content:encoded:

Budgeting for the basic sanitation needs of the camps was something the Mayor VETOED in last years city budget. It would have cost a fraction of what he is considering raising the police budget by. Maybe he is more interested in ticketing people for littering than providing trash pick up in the first place.

Just like someone would do if you wanted to blame the homeless for something that is your responsibility. Oh wait, out Mayor has promised (through accepting certain campaign contributions) that he would serve the wealthy real-estate lobby irregardless of the cost to the poor in our city.

item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Likely First Snow on Tuesday - Survival Gear Needed

It is supposed to snow and be a high of 37 on Tuesday. This will be a sudden drop from 91 the day before. This is a recipe for danger for those living without housing. If you can donate a tent, tarp, sleeping bag, blanket, coat, soaks, or hand warmers folks can use this gear! Bring these items to our office on Monday at 2260 California St between 9am and 5pm. Or give them directly to people you know who need them.

This is t...he same day as a sweep is planned for the camp at 25th and Arapahoe. Will the city really take peoples only blankets, tents, ect as it is snowing and freezing and scatter folks to nowhere with nothing to cover oneself???

Contact the Mayor and demand he find a heart.

item.title: Denver Housing Authority lottery day for Section 8 for 2021 is...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Denver Housing Authority lottery day for Section 8 for 2021 is September 17th and 18th, 2020.

Not such big news... because..
If you win, your name goes on a waiting list. Yep you do not get housing for winning the the Denver Housing Authority lottery. You get your name on a wait list. Why are there restrictions for getting peoples name on a wait lists to begin with? You have to win a lottery just to have you name on a wait list. That is how bad housing has been for dec...ades. It takes lottery luck just to get your name on a years long wait list that usually winds up being years longer than reported it would take when your name is first placed on it.

for details on how to access the lottery click the link.
